data.title: Oregon Cabaret Theatre 2025 Season - LA EPA (08.21.24)
data.text:
Job Details

DESCRIPTION

CALL TYPE

EPA

CONTRACT

Dinner Theatre

$585 weekly minimum (Tier 1)

AUDITION DATE

Wednesday, August 21, 2024

9:00 AM - 5:00 PM (P)

BREAK: 12:00PM - 1:00PM

LOCATION

Actors' Equity Association LA Audition Center

5636 Tujunga Ave

North Hollywood, CA 91601

PERSONNEL

Personnel: Artistic Director - Valerie Rachelle

Managing Director - Rick Robinson

Casting Director/Associate Artistic Director - Lauren Blair

EXPECTED TO ATTEND:

Lauren Blair as Casting Director/Associate Artistic Director

Daniel Koh as Music Supervisor

Kristie Mattson as support staff/reader

OTHER DATES

Gents Guide: Jan 3rd to March 30th

Waitress: March 17th to June 15th

Disaster: June 2nd to Sept 7th

Murder to Two: August 29th to Nov 9th

Nutcracker: Oct 20th to Dec 31st, 202

OTHER

EPA Procedures are in effect for this audition.

An Equity Monitor will be provided.

Equity’s contracts prohibit discrimination. Equity is committed to diversity and encourages all its employers to engage in a policy of equal employment opportunity designed to promote a positive model of inclusion. As such, Equity encourages performers of all ethnicities, gender identities, and ages, as well as performers with disabilities, to attend every audition.

Always bring your Equity Membership card to auditions.

SEEKING

Equity actors for roles in Oregon Cabaret Theatre's 2025 season (see breakdown).

All Stage Managerial positions are currently filled.

PREPARATION

Please prepare a 60 second monologue, and 32 bars of any song from a musical - may sing or monologue from any of the shows. Please bring your headshot and resume stapled together.

BREAKDOWN

OREGON CABARET THEATRE 2025 SEASON

Producer contact information:

Producer: Valerie Rachelle

241 Hargadine St. Ashland, OR 97520

541 499-8349 ext.3

A GENTLEMAN’S GUIDE TO LOVE AND MURDER

Valerie Rachelle - Director/Choreographer

Sarah Wussow - Musical Director

SEEKING:

MONTY NAVARRO (age 20s - 30s) Any Ethnicity. Clever and charismatic, vulnerable and endearing, with a highly developed appreciation for life’s ironies. Discovers he is in line to become the Earl of Highurst, and sets out to kill off the family that stands in his way. Must have a winning charm that would garner anybody’s trust. A2-A4

SIBELLA (age 20s - 30s) Any Ethnicity. A flirtatious, narcissistic, willful, girl that Monty loves-calculating and irresistible. A social climber but also truly loves Monty, and in the end would do anything to protect him. Tremendous wit and high style. F#3-A5

PHOEBE (age 20s - 30s) Any Ethnicity. Virtuous, forthright, romantic, comically earnest, but with a backbone of steel. Not your typical ingenue, she has a sense of irony and humor in addition to a youthful innocence behind her sophistication. B3 to C#6 (option to Eb6)

ENSEMBLE (age and gender fluid) Any Ethnicity. Character actors to play a multitude or roles. strong singing skills required.

WAITRESS

Lauren Blair - Director/Choreographer

SEEKING:

DAWN (age 20s) Any Ethnicity. A waitress at Joe’s Diner. She is charming, kind, and socially awkward- loves her world in perfect order. She has a small touch of OCD and continually rearranges the tables at the diner. She spends her evenings with her TV dinners and her cat. G3-E5

BECKY (age 40s - 50s) African American. A waitress at Joe’s Diner. She is saucy, hot-tempered, been there, made it back, and somehow kept her sense of humor. Honest and loyal to her gals at the diner and tells them how it is. Eb3-E5

DR. POMATTER (age 30s - 40s) Any Ethnicity. Jenna’s gynecologist turned lover. He is endearing, genuine, clumsy in manner, a bit neurotic, and has sweaty palms. He has a quirky sense of humor and a big heart. Loves desserts and speaks before he thinks. Bb4- Bb2

DISASTER!

SEEKING

CHAD (age 30s - 40s) Any Ethnicity. A caterer at the casino who was previously engaged to Marianne. Winning personality and pretends to be a player, but is still really heartbroken over the loss of his first love. B2-B4

MARIANNE (age 30s) Any Ethnicity. Focused journalist and ex-fiancé of Chad. She left him to pursue her career. Insecure underneath it all. B3-F#5

SHIRLEY (age 50s - 60s) Any Ethnicity. A visitor at the casino, lovable and jolly. Traveling with her beloved husband Murray. A3-B4

LENORA VERONA (age 30s - 40s) Any Ethnicity. A flamboyant and glamorous faded disco diva. Pushy and sassy but in love with her sweet dog. B3-E5

MURDER FOR TWO

Alex Boyles - Director

SEEKING:

MARCUS (age and gender fluid) Any Ethnicity. An ambitious officer. Doubles other characters including a grizzled boss, and a former lover. NOTE: Piano playing is a must.

THE SUSPECTS (age and gender fluid) Any Ethnicity. Doubles multiple characters, including an overeager grad student, a loopy widow, a friendly psychiatrist, and a self-incriminating ballerina. NOTE: Piano playing is a must.

THE NUTCRACKER AND THE MOUSE KING

Director - Rick Robinson

SEEKING:

UNCLE DROSSELMEYER (age 30s - 50s) Any Ethnicity. Not your typical Nutcracker ballet. Doubles multiple roles. NOTE: Puppetry experience and knowledge of any instruments is a plus. MARIE (age 20s) Any Ethnicity. Not your typical Nutcracker ballet. Doubles multiple roles. NOTE: Puppetry experience and knowledge of any instruments is a plus.

SALARY

Dinner Theatre $585 weekly minimum (Tier 1)

UNION

AEA
